it.polimi.ingsw.server.bootstrap

Class GameInitializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.server.bootstrap.GameInitializer

  • public class GameInitializer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class initializes a Game waiting for the correct amount of views from the waiting room to create a controller which will handle the match

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int matchStartTimeoutMilliseconds
      Time to wait before automatically start a match when the minimum number of participants is available
      private int maxParticipants
      Maximum number of participant.
      private int minParticipants
      The minimum number of participants needed to start a match
      private java.util.List<View> participants
      This list accumulates the participants waiting for a match
      private WaitingRoom participantSource
      The waiting room that will be queried periodically to get new participants
      private static int WAITING_ROOM_QUERY_DELAY
      Delay between waiting room queries

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameInitializer(WaitingRoom participantSource, int matchStartTimeoutMilliseconds, int minParticipants, int maxParticipants)
      Constructs a game initializer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Controller initialize()
      Starts a blocking loop that will wait until the conditions needed to create a match are fulfilled
      private <T> T playersChoice(java.util.stream.Stream<T> choices)

        Delay between waiting room queries

        Constant Field Values

      • matchStartTimeoutMilliseconds

        private int matchStartTimeoutMilliseconds
        Time to wait before automatically start a match when the minimum number of participants is available

      • maxParticipants

        private int maxParticipants
        Maximum number of participant. When this number is reached a new match starts without waiting the timeout

      • minParticipants

        private int minParticipants
        The minimum number of participants needed to start a match

      • participants

        private final java.util.List<View> participants
        This list accumulates the participants waiting for a match

      • participantSource

        private WaitingRoom participantSource
        The waiting room that will be queried periodically to get new participants

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameInitializer

        public GameInitializer(WaitingRoom participantSource,
                       int matchStartTimeoutMilliseconds,
                       int minParticipants,
                       int maxParticipants)
        Constructs a game initializer
        Parameters:
        participantSource - a waiting room to take participants from
        matchStartTimeoutMilliseconds - the time to wait before starting a match with at least the minimum number of participants
        minParticipants - the minimum number of participants
        maxParticipants - the maximum number of participants

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public Controller initialize()
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Starts a blocking loop that will wait until the conditions needed to create a match are fulfilled
        Returns:
        a Controller instance initialized with a valid Match and the Views
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the loop is forced to stop

      • playersChoice

        private <T> T playersChoice(java.util.stream.Stream<T> choices)
        Determines the result of the player votes about some choices regarding the match initial setup
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of those choices
        Parameters:
        choices - a stream of players' choices
        Returns:
        the winning choice
